sen.j: 執権（しっけん）は、鎌倉幕府の職名。
sen.e: Shikken is a name of a post in the Kamakura bakufu.
Shikken is a name of a post in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: Kamakura bakufu の後に (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) を追加。
sen.e: Shikken is a name of a post in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 鎌倉殿を助け政務を統轄した。
sen.e: Shikken supported Kamakura-dono (another name for shogun and it often meant the Kamakura bakufu as well) and controlled the affairs of state.

sen.j: 元来は、政所の別当の中心となるものの呼称であった。
sen.e: Originally, Shikken was the name of the post which was the director of Board of Administration called Mandokoro-betto.

sen.j: なお、鎌倉時代には院庁の政所別当も幕府に倣って執権と呼称された。
sen.e: During the Kamakura period, Mandokoro-betto in In-no-cho (department under the direct control of the retired emperor) was also called Shikken by following the way that the bakufu called it.

sen.j: いわゆる初代の「執権」は、初代将軍源頼朝の妻北条政子の父北条時政。
sen.e: The first so-called "Shikken" was Tokimasa HOJO who was the father of Masako HOJO, the wife of the first shogun Yoritomo MINAMOTO.

sen.j: 時政の就任以来、北条氏の権力確立の足場となる。
sen.e: SinceTokimasa was appointed to the post of Shikken, he provided the Hojo family with a foothold of their political power.

sen.j: 2代執権の北条義時が侍所の別当を兼ねてからは、事実上、幕府の最高の職となった。
sen.e: Since the second Shikken Yoshitoki HOJO started serving also as Samuraidokoro-betto (board of retainers), Shikken practically became the highest post in the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 源氏の将軍が3代の源実朝で途絶えてからは、執権が幕府の実権を握るようになった。
sen.e: After the third generation Sanetomo MINAMOTO died and the rule of Minamoto Shoguns came to an end, Shikken took the control of the bakufu.

sen.j: 6代の北条長時以降は、北条家の家督を継いだ得宗以外からも執権に就任するようになった。
sen.e: Since the 6th generation Nagatoki HOJO, Shikken had been appointed also from those other than Tokuso which was a mainline of the Hojo clan.

sen.j: これ以降、得宗と執権が分離し、実際の権力は得宗が持つようになり、執権は名目上の地位となった。
sen.e: Tokuso and the post of Shikken were separated since then, and the actual power in the bakufu was held by Tokuso and Shikken became only a nominal post.

sen.e: Moreover, during the days of Takatoki HOJO, the Nagasaki family who were at the butler-like position for the Hojo clan called Naikanrei started seizing power.
